title: StatSocial Platform
description:
API Reference:

The StatSocial API is organized around REST. Our API is designed to have predictable, resource-oriented URLs and to use HTTP response codes to indicate API errors. We use built-in HTTP features, like HTTP authentication and HTTP verbs, which can be understood by off-the-shelf HTTP clients, and we support cross-origin resource sharing to allow you to interact securely with our API from a client-side web application (remember that you should never expose your secret API key in any public website's client-side code). JSON will be returned in all responses from the API, including errors (though if you're using API bindings, we will convert the response to the appropriate language-specific object).

Contact help@statsocial.com to obtain a test API key

get_applications_status_.title: Used to understand API usage
get_applications_status_.description: Remaining window and remaining count details, also returns reports that have been generated by this account.

get_reports_.title: Obtain report output
get_reports_.description: Output is ordered by Demographic and followed by Affinity information. For each data point the following metrics are provided value, count, mean, percentile, multiplicity and average. For Geographic, and Demographic data points an additional statistical_info metric will be present with information regarding statistical relevance.

post_reports_.title: Obtain report output
post_reports_.description: Output is ordered by Demographic and followed by Affinity information. For each data point the following metrics are provided value, count, mean, percentile, multiplicity and average. For Geographic, and Demographic data points an additional statistical_info metric will be present with information regarding statistical relevance.

get_reports_custom_create_.title: Step 3 of executing custom report
get_reports_custom_create_.description: Used to create a custom report. This report treats the list of ids or handles as the audience (not their followers as in the twitter report). To create follower or tweet reports other methods must be used.

post_reports_custom_create_.title: Step 3 of executing custom report
post_reports_custom_create_.description: Used to create a custom report. This report treats the list of ids or handles as the audience (not their followers as in the twitter report). To create follower or tweet reports other methods must be used.

get_reports_custom_generate_.title: Step 1 of executing custom report
get_reports_custom_generate_.description: Used to create a custom report. This report treats the list of ids or handles as the audience (not their followers as in the twitter report). To create follower or tweet reports other methods must be used.

post_reports_custom_generate_.title: Step 1 of executing custom report
post_reports_custom_generate_.description: Used to create a custom report. This report treats the list of ids or handles as the audience (not their followers as in the twitter report). To create follower or tweet reports other methods must be used.

get_reports_custom_insert_.title: Step 2 of executing custom report
get_reports_custom_insert_.description: Inserting twitter ids or handles into a custom report. This is used for custom reports only

post_reports_custom_insert_.title: Step 2 of executing custom report
post_reports_custom_insert_.description: Inserting twitter ids or handles into a custom report. This is used for custom reports only

get_reports_dates_.title: Get report dates available for a specific report
get_reports_dates_.description: Get report dates available for a specific report.

post_reports_dates_.title: Get report dates available for a specific report
post_reports_dates_.description: Get report dates available for a specific report.

get_reports_status_.title: Get list of generated reports
get_reports_status_.description: Returns a list of custom reports generated by user (report name to upload hash etc).

post_reports_status_.title: Get list of generated reports
post_reports_status_.description: Returns a list of custom reports generated by user (report name to upload hash etc).

get_reports_tweet_create_.title: Used to create tweet reports
get_reports_tweet_create_.description: This report details the audience of the users who have tweeted content that matches what was provided in the keywords. To create custom or twitter reports other methods must be used.

post_reports_tweet_create_.title: Used to create tweet reports
post_reports_tweet_create_.description: This report details the audience of the users who have tweeted content that matches what was provided in the keywords. To create custom or twitter reports other methods must be used.

get_reports_twitter_create_.title: Used to create twitter follower report
get_reports_twitter_create_.description: This report uses the twitter followers as the audience. To create custom or tweet reports other methods must be used. Any report older than two days will be automatically regenerated upon create.

post_reports_twitter_create_.title: Used to create twitter follower report
post_reports_twitter_create_.description: This report uses the twitter followers as the audience. To create custom or tweet reports other methods must be used. Any report older than two days will be automatically regenerated upon create.
